ratings.comment: Professor Valley is an expert in his field and has a great passion in teaching Geoscience. Though the exams may be kind of hard, but as long as you attend lectures and lab sessions, you can get a good grade.

Overall I enjoyed Professor Valley's lectures. He co teaches with another professor and he is by far more interesting and easy to follow. The class is kind of dull but he is passionate about the topic which makes it more interesting. Tests can be difficult but if you go to discussions it's not hard to get an A.

He is a super nice guy and really cares about his topic. He has a lot of experience in the field which makes him fun to listen to. While this class doesn't have study guides, he provides key terms and concepts at the end of his lecture slides, and that was really helpful.
Terrible class. Do not take

Valley shares his class with another professor so you do not see him a lot.  He speaks clearly and his material is easy to understand with a basic science background. He is mostly interesting and funny, but tests are sometimes worded funny. Go to discussion and the worksheets are graded and study notes/read textbook for an easy A.

Geology was my favorite class this semester because of Professor Valley. He does a great job connecting the material to his real-life experiences in the field. You learn so much about how the world works in this class, it's not just about rocks. Class isn't too challenging, but make sure to do the in-class tophat questions, they help a lot.
Professor Valley is a great professor and I was very pleased with his lectures. He loves demonstrations.

He was one of my nicest professors this semester. He is really educated on this coarse and helps when you need it. His lecture slides are kind of confusing but when he explains you get it more. Exams are difficult, a lot of effort put into studying. Cumulative final. Questions asked are really specific (things you would not think to study)

John is such a nice and pleasant professor. He was attentive toward needs when approached and brought in demos to help explain topics. My only issue was the difficulty of exams for a 100 level course. The exams are scantron and ask questions irrelevant to big topics, but focus on little things that weren't covered. NOT "rocks for jocks"
Very easy to understand and helpful. If you understand the material given and do all the readings, you will get an A.

He seems like a great guy, but his lectures are kind of hard to follow, they're mostly just pictures (a lot of his vacation photos). Co-taught with Feigl. Very difficult tests, though curved. Clickr questions are annoying but keep you accountable on the readings.

Pretty good professor. He's lenient on clicker questions and has a lot of anecdotal stories to tell during lectures. This is by no means an easy A class though. Tests are very difficult and you'll have to study A LOT if you want an AB or higher.

Prof. Valley is an amazing lecturer. Teaches the material at a happy medium pace, slow enough that you can take comprehensive notes, but fast enough that you stay interested. Has loads of interesting stories to tell that are usually relevant to the topic at hand. Really nice guy. Definitely a professor I'd recommend.

iClicker questions are far too difficult and graded for correctness each lecture. There are only a midterm and final, which are very hard and not straight forward at all. Some questions are on slightest details. Overall this class is way to hard to be a  100-level. He's better than the other professor, but still hated this class as a whole.

Professor Valley was great for Geology 100.  His lectures and the discussions are interesting.  It is important to go to each lecture, because you get points for answering iClicker questions.  The test were tough, but the class overall was not too difficult.

Lectures are super interesting, and he always has a picture he has taken relating to what were talking about. Reading the book is necessary for exams. He knows what he is talking about but not everything is written on the slides so it is best to read the book. In lecture, clicker participation is part of grade.  You do the homework in discussion.

Very interesting lecture, but that didn't help out much on the exams. Study the text book more than your notes. John is better than the other guy. He should be the only one teaching this class and the tests should be on his lectures, not an assessment of how much of the text book we can memorize.

Although some of his lectures may be a bit dry for some, they provide most of the information you will. But that doesn't mean you wont have to use the book. The tests are almost entirely term based with the remainder being simple concept based problems. Getting an A/AB is easy if you go to lecture and due the homework.
Awesome professor and just a great guy overall, really enjoyed this class and hope to take another course he offers if possible.

Prof. Valley is a great lecturer.  He gets his main points across efficiently, and still manages to make lecture interesting.  He heavily uses iClickers for in-class points, so be sure to go to lecture!  Exams draw heavily on knowledge from the book, so be sure to do the readings!  Don't fall behind, because the whole textbook is covered!

Valley is an absolute jewel.  The exams, yes, are pretty difficult, BUT they do put a pretty good curve on them. Lab/Disc/Homework is easy. Require use of electronic clicker for class participation grade. All a bit arbitrary, but Valley's lectures make the class completely worth it.

This is no longer "rocks for jocks". The exams are horrible. They give you emphasized material but the exams are much more in depth than that. I prefer Valley over the other Professor though. Interesting, but exams are too brutal

Apparently this class WAS supposed to be easy. BUT not really. The exams are brutal, not so great of a curve. Apparently the requirements were changed summer 2009 so it became harder. Nice nice guy. Somewhat interesting material, just HARD exams that test on way too much stuff (which is typical of any Gen Ed though)
really great guy. awesome guy. good class.

This class has been pretty interesting, but the midterm was indeed quite brutal. Definitely watch the movie in lecture - it WILL be on the next test, from my experience! John Valley is so passionate about geology, and the co-professor Kurt Feigl added some humor to the already light atmosphere set by Valley, which made for a good time overall.

Valley was a very good prof. Taking the practice exam or the previous mid term if he posts one on the website is good preperation for the mid term. I also thought the tests were fairly easy in general plus there was a huge curve. I belive a 79-100 was an A for the mid term. Grade was 20% mid term 1, 40% lab homework and 40% final.
John Valley is a good man who loves his rocks
Great guy, very straight forward lectures.  Tests are diffucult (Even the TA's agreed)
good guy, really passionate
i loved this class. prof. valley made rocks really interesting and he is really passionate about geology.

Great teacher makes things very intresting and fun. He has a real passion for geology and shows that in his teaching. I didnet want to take geology but needed to as a requirement and ended up loving it and considering it as a dual mmajor. I highly suggest Valley!!

Prof. Valley is a great guy.  He manages to make geology interesting with movies and his photos.  Its obvious he knows his stuff and is able to teach it pretty well.  His exams are hard, but he does curve it nicely so in the end its not bad at all.

Do not pass up a chance to take a class with Professor Valley! He knows geology more than anybody on the planet. When he shows a film, it WILL be on the test. His tests are brutal, but he curves it nicely. A 59 gave me an AB.

very excited and interested in what he is teaching and been to most places he talks about.. which makes for good pictures in the slide shows! Explains things very well in lecture, midterms are brutal. Movies are on Tests!
I loved him he is very good at explaining things and he is genuinly intrested in his subject. TAKE HIM!!
He is super boring and the material is very dry.  The midterm is rough, even if you studied you dont really know whats going on.  Way too hard for a 100 level class.
i took geology last year at oshkosh west with mr roberts, and maybe he was just really good, but i know most of what we're doing now, and it's dull sometimes, but i like the subject.

Excellent lectures.  The material was clear and followed the book.  If you miss a lecture, don't sweat it, you can find what you missed in the book.  Very smart man, friendly, good jokes.  Watch out -- if he shows you a movie, it WILL be on the exam.

Very good professor, he makes an absolutely boring subject somewhat liveable.  Make sure you read everything in the books...because the midterm was brutal! I think average score was like 62% or something.

Can be boring when he talks on about obscure things, but i thought he was pretty strait forward.  Uses lots of pretty pictures to occupy the minds of the ADD minded like me.  The midterm was a bit rough though, some of the questions can be confusing, and there were some i never seen before.

Excellent lectures. He's always prepared for class and brings in other media to convey main points.  He's incredibly knowledgeable, and it shows in his lectures. Semi-challenging midterm and final, but it was worth it to have him as a professor!

This class was supposed to be an easy A, but geology is a really different science than the ones you take in high school, and this professor and the TA do not work hard to help the students understand.  To get a full explanation for anything you really have to bother them.  It is extremely boring.

Beware: It seems like it's easy until you take the midterm--Almost nothing on the midterm was covered in class, and he said that that's what it would be on. The average score was a 56/84...Discussion is a nightmare--vague homework questions, hard to get all the points unless you bug the TA a lot!
good teacher, boring class
I thought this was a hard class and the lectures were pretty boring.  I had to stay caught up with reading to understand material... also discussion was helpful
No Comments
BORING, I feel asleep in class everyday (I NEVER FALL ASLEEP IN ANY CLASS!!)
